title: Hotel Stays and Marginal Distribution
question_text: Do guests from out of state tend to stay at a hotel longer?  The Hotel Association in a certain state decided to investigate. A random sample of hotel stays from various hotels in the state was selected, and for each stay the Hotel Association recorded whether the guest was a resident of the state, a resident of a neighboring state, or a resident of a distant state.  They also recorded whether the guest stayed for a single night or for multiple nights.  The results are shown in the table below.
